column4: Noda, while you're at it, how do I check if I've got open ports?
If you don't configure MySQL, it doesn't even listen on the network.
That's true, but you're also using a less awesome video player ;)
just giving the option. Breaking ubuntu-desktop can be unpleasant.
Ooh, thanks for reminding me, actually! Apparently there's some new stuff (mozilla-firefox-gnome-support, openoffice.org-gtk-gnome, readahead)
do you know a way to handle encryped dvds? I've got a set of dvd's by universal that refuse to play. :-S
Yes, that's in the FAQ on ubuntu's website
the problem is. I've got libdvdcss already
Run "totem" from the console and try to play a movie, check if the debug output is useful
it'll run the dvd menu, but once the film starts, it quits.
I've never heard of that. What's the debug output? :)
Totem won't open the dvd, gxine will, then crashes.
that icon is fucked up, appears right on top of other icons. :-S
I've seen that too. Hasn't (yet) annoyed me enough to make me look into it :)
is that worth filing a bug over, and for wich package?
The package would be Nautilus. I'm sure the bug exists already. I'll search for it.
